alert.note: Alert for Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 1:13AM MDT until April 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Major severity for the following rivers in South Dakota... Little Minnesota River near Peever affecting Roberts County. .The following river forecasts include forecast precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any additional future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Little Minnesota River near Peever. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Fields begin to flood. This is the new gage site approx 1 mile north of old site. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM CDT Thursday was 22.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to peak soon, then steadily fall, dropping below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Friday.
